reviews.text: We came for brunch on Sunday and it was so great! We have never had a bad experience at a cheesecake factory, but this was our first time here for brunch. The breakfast burrito 🌯 was delicious and the Monte Cristo was great as well. The home fries were perfectly crispy. The peach 🍑 Bellini was straight perfection! The Carmel macchiato ☕ was super sweet. Obviously the cheesecake factory never disappoints.

Service was amazing. There was a wait but the hostess sat us as soon as possible and the waiter was amazing. Prompt, courteous, friendly and attentive. The food was phenomenal in presentation and flavor. Wow! Can't remember a time I've had such an amazing experience anywhere else. Definitely plan to return.

Located I'm Clarendon so there's some street parking snd somewhere parking garages around. I had called ahead to order ab10 inch cheesecake and a Happy Birthday chocolate plaque to pick up. Thay interaction was a little strange as she asked me if I wanted my sour cream for the cheesecake on top or on the side. I thought she had meant whipped crean but she insisted it was sour cream and then also forgot to take my name until I mentioned if she needed addition information for me to pick it up.

We came here for dinner and sat down in addition to picking up the cake. The dinner was great and service was amazing. I ordered a skinny mojito and my boyfriend ordered the Bourbon and Honey. Both were great. For our appetizers, we ordered the Korean Fried Cauliflower and the Chicken Taquitos. The Cauliflower was really good but took some time to make.  I ordered the taquitos probably 15 min after when we were putting in our entrees and it still came out first. It was airtight, good flavor but actually a little cold inside.

For dinner I ordered the Grilled Steak Medallions and my boyfriend ordered the Truffle Honey Chicken. The steak Medallions were good. They were well cooked and the mashed potatoes and shiitake mushrooms were good too. The truffle Honey chicken was a little disappointing. Not too much flavor but it was a decent fried chicken.

Service was great. Our server was attentive and helped us grab the cheesecake that we ordered. It did come with sour cream which to me is still very strange.

It’s usually difficult to write a review for a Cheesecake Factory restaurant and here is why: the dishes are delicious (same menu every where, maybe pre-made dishes?), the setting / ambiance is cozy but the service is medium or even mediocre. This one was no exception: the service was medium minus. The waitress made a couple of mistakes and we had to ask for refills for drinks many times. But the dishes were those we love in these restaurants… So I guess we can say the whole experience was average.

I've visited this location only once so far, and only The Cheesecake Factory locations very few times, however was not disappointed. Despite reviews, we did not encounter any subpar service, but simply satisfactory. The location was nice, large open areas, and seemingly clean. There were some very loud patrons watching soccer at the bar. Very loud. The building was also positioned in a way that during my visit at dinner, the light shines through the store fascia and reflects off of various surfaces causing tons of glare.

As for the menu and food, there are a ton of options. I had the club sandwich and coconut cheesecake. Both were generously portioned although the prices were satisfactory. Of the options, it was hard to decide but I believe you can't go wrong. Don't come here if you're looking to diet, although there are diet-friendly options.

We enjoyed this place. Food was pretty good. One of the draft beers did not taste right, but they let us get a different one. Seemed like it went bad. They had all the NFL games. I would recommend this place.

I’d rate 3-3.5 stars, I came for a private event and was told it was in the back of the rooftop. While the rooftop seems like a good venue, they really need better lighting - it was super dark and unlit whereas the area near the registers was decently lit.

Service was alright, it seemed our private party was forgotten about and never had our water refilled. Also it might have been just the one time I came, but the system to close out tabs was down so they had to take my card downstairs to close out.

I had to come back for my card which was a slight nuisance since I was at a networking event, but it’s not the workers’ fault.

The food was decent (do NOT get the blooming onion unless you want breading that falls off the onion pieces leading to you eating basically raw onion) and surprisingly decently priced but I would just go downstairs to the other restaurants for food instead.
My wife and I were the only customers. My steak and cheese was a little dry and there wasn't very much meat or cheese. My wife's salad was wilted.

Because of Google Maps images of the menu, I expected a veggie burger when I got there. They didn't have one, but they did have this tomato-mozarella sandwich that reminded me of a panini I would get where I used to live. I enjoyed it.

Good sports bar experience. We stopped in for a quick lunch while we were in Arlington. The staff was super-friendly. The men has good variety. The food was decent bar food. Nothing special, but not bad. The chips & queso was surprisingly good...highly recommend.  There are lots of TVs, so we could see all the games at once.

A lovely brunch atmosphere that is light on the wallet and heavy on the pours. Choose from a small list of bottomless liquor options which pair nicely with the avocado toast or the all American breakfast, my personal favorite was the chicken sausage and my salmon eggs Benedict it was *chef kiss*! Parking wasn’t the best so getting their prior to your reservation time is key Sundays are awesome cuz parking is free otherwise 2 hour parking signs are your best bet. Come hungry and leave happy the customer service and food was a lovely  Sunday Brunch outing! Liberty Tavern did not disappoint, stop by if you’re in the area!

Loved this place! Their outside seating is 🐾DOG FRIENDLY🐾. The service was excellent and very attentive. And the food! Absolutely delicious. The best fried chicken sandwich and tomato soup! Highly recommend.

My sister and I decided to go to Liberty to celebrate our reunion! Brunch was delicious! I definitely enjoyed my first big brunch back after being away for a few months. My favorites were the biscuits, shrimp and grits, and veggie quiche. The French toast and deviled eggs were just ok. I also tasted the fried chicken with the hot honey. Goodness! I didn’t drink alcohol but my sister tasted some of their drinks. I believe they have a grapefruit drink that she liked. I had orange juice that was in a large glass. Great service. Will return!

Very attentive service!
Every dish was in pretty huge portion but some lacks refinement in presentation.
Do get the all-American breakfast!

Some of the best food we’ve had so far, the Scottish Salmon was cooked perfectly and the greens and mushrooms were nicely buttered. Didn’t expect it to be proper food, but it was. The Rigatoni  and meatball was also prepared really well. The half portion is perfect for one person.

The inside was a bit loud, but that’s to be expected on a Friday night. The waiter was really friendly and overall we had an excellent experience. They did have seating outside, which we will do next time. Definitely coming back again.

name: The Italian Store at Lyon Village

reviews.text:
Phenomenal subs. I got the Capri, which I found was a great combination of salty, sweet and sour. Their bread is nice and soft, but doesn’t fall apart when you bite into it.

My wife got a the Nino pizza - one slice. Great pizza as well. Make sure you like cheese if you order this.

Aside from the food, there’s a great selection of Italian snack, pasta, wine and cheese. Make sure you check out the frozen section for frozen ravioli.

By far the best pizza in the DMV area from my experience both stores are great. I've only ever bought 🍕's  from these stores.  But I've heard their subs are just as amazing. Expect to pay $25 on a large pie but so worth it. I live about thirty plus minutes away and still worth the drive to pick it up.

This is my favorite Italian sub deli in NOVA for last 40 yrs.  But first time since the pandemic and subs are “grab & go” now.  🙁 For customized subs you have to call ahead.  I picked up pre-made Capri and Milano and they are not as good as fresh made; no oil & vinegar, can’t mix sweet & hot peppers.  I likes its Italians subs with all the trimming and I was a bit disappointed.  I’ll definitely call ahead next time.
It’s an authentic Italian grocery shop with deli. I had a cheese slice. it was okay. Definitely not NY style pizza.

We have been out of the country for 3 years and had been seeing of the day we could return for a sandwich from the Italian store - our dreams came true today! We love the grab and go system that is in place now! Doesn't make choosing a sandwich much easier, but does help with a faster turn around time. So tasty and just wonderful as usual. Thanks for a wonderful experience!

Really blown away by this place! First time we had it (today), we got takeout and everything was delicious! It was so good as takeout, so we’re definitely planning on going to eat in the restaurant. We ordered A LOT! The Buffalo Chicken Wrap (which I can say is my favorite - and I’ve had a lot of Buffalo chicken wraps), Lamb Gyro, Steak Quesadilla, Grilled Wings, and a side of Jambalaya (also one of my favorites and love that you can get it as a side!!) I honestly can’t wait to go back and try some more items.
Had a nice experience here on a Monday evening. They have happy hour till 6pm and also a trivia game that starts around 7pm. The servers were friendly and the food was good.

I stopped in for lunch between doctors appointments today and had a great experience. The food was good, the service was quick and attentive, and my frozen white peach margarita was great. I recommend the French dip and the house made voodoo chips! I would definitely come back.

This was my second time here. First time I was very pleased. They have pretty good food and drinks. This time was terrible. Not sure why my server was sitting down on her phone almost the entire time I was there. If you are going to be on the phone at least get my order correct. Or maybe don’t sit right where your guests can see you. The manager and other workers were helpful so it really does suck, but I will not return.

Fun and lively bar with a tasteful New Orleans theme. The food was great. I got jambalaya with blackened shrimp! The drinks were even better. Friendly staff and patrons, everyone down for a conversation.

Stopped in on a weekend trip for brunch and this Bakery is great! It’s easy to get to from the hotel and way better food than what the hotel had! Should’ve had breakfast here twice! The fresh biscuits and rolls were delicious! We tried the quiche and also liked that. Was a bit disappointed a lot of things that were on the menu weren’t available though when we went. With no clear signage that basically if those items aren’t in the case then they don’t have them. It’s always a peeve when then the host gets rude as if I, guest, am supposed to know that and where they store what; after rushing me forward to order when then other things aren’t prepared for the menu that were also full kitchen items. My host was a bit rude while their coworkers serving other guests seemed nicer and less abrasive. But all in all a great spot and he did NOT ruin my experience! They have this pepper jam by the pick up counter that was absolutely delicious! The prices were great too and liked how I could build out my sandwich to my dietary restrictions. They’re spacious with a great ambiance too! I really liked seeing their light fixtures which were really unique! I’d definitely go back again and recommend you stop in if you’re in the area.

The food was amazing and they even have frozen alcoholic slushies.  I had the gumbo and their specialty grilled cheese. Go check out the places. The people who work there have a beautiful spirit and you always feel welcomed. The place is like a small art museum with a bit of historical facts posted on the walls. Check it out. You'll definitely return. I know I will.

Out of this world biscuits. I should have gotten the pimento bacon egg biscuit because the cheese just melted everywhere and looked delicious but ended up getting the cheddar bacon egg biscuit because of my nightshade allergy. Also got the praline latte that was lip smacking good.

Would definitely recommend this place for a delicious breakfast stop before moving on to your day’s fun activities🥳

Amazing plan buttermilk biscuits!

We had a a sampler brunch and I’m sorry the photos do not do our food justice.  We carried out as it was too crowded to get a seat, and the food help up really well!

We had:
Plain buttermilk biscuits- THE SOFT AND FLUFFY STAR OF THE SHOW

Avocado Benedict - YUM!  Who doesn’t like runny egg on tater tot’s?!?

Beignets - which were light and tasty and dusted with powdered sugar.  BF did not see the point in them.

Cornbread.  I heard it was good but was WAY to fill to taste it.

An excellent latte that was lovely and NOT acidic / butter.

I was planning to give this place 4 stars, but my friend and I both had tummy troubles shortly after our meals. Outside of that, the meal was generally pretty tasty. Took about 30 mins from the time we got in line to get our food on a Saturday around 10 am. Things that can be improved was that the biscuit was a bit dry and sandwich was smaller than expected.

name: Bonchon Arlington
vicinity: 2201 North Pershing Drive Suite E, Arlington

reviews.text: Ordered for delivery. The onion ring was very good - very crispy! The bibimbap has a good portion and was delicious although it’s not very authentic Korean style in my opinion. Soy garlic wings were good, but the spicy wings were too spicy for us. Overall, we enjoyed the food delivery from here!

The food here is very good and I quite like a lady named Ruby because she takes good care of my table.  I don't understand why there 2 staff members who suggested that they would serve the table for my family but they didn't even bring out forks and plates for us to eat.  So when we ate, since we didn't have a plate, we made everything at the table look messy.  Luckily Ruby from the other table noticed us and helped us when needed.  5 stars for Ruby and 5 stars for the food.
Loved the beef Bolgolgi! We also had the chicken with garlic soy sauce and kimchi coleslaw. The chicken was crispy yet juicy. Everything was delicious and fresh.

It was my first time eating here and let me say, I enjoyed the spicy Korean chicken wings and the fried rice. It was like a sticky rice but still good.  The waitress was nice and it was quite empty in there. Don't let that deter you from eating there. There is a full bar and the atmosphere was such a vibe. I enjoyed my visit on that Monday so much that I went back the next day for lunch again. Very flavorful wings. If you don't like spicy food, the wings aren't for you.

Bonchon is prolly one of the best Korean restaurants in the area, Very clean environment, Good Service, nice selection of  Items on the menu, You can't go wrong with the Chicken wings, also the Korean Tacos are really good too.. overall good place for lunch..

Loved the food and vibe here. We ordered the boneless wings (super crispy btw), chicken pot pie, fish and chips, nachos and couple of drinks .  Everything tasted  really good and wasn’t greasy! The service was super quick, the atmosphere was fun and lively, especially after 9pm with the live karaoke! Would definitely recommend this spot if you are looking for chill spot to hang with delish food, drinks, and music.

One of my favorite Irish pubs I have visited. Service is fast, customer service is top notch and the Fish and chips were quite impressive and generous in the portions. Not all supposed Irish pubs feel very authentic but this one fits the bill for drink selection, Irish atmosphere, good food, friendliness and an all around warm experience head to toe.

Great atmosphere, food and service.  Overall a welcoming and pleasant venue.  Big thanks to Mary -  Who put up with a rowdy bunch of Marines who may have forgotten they were not in the barracks.  I would go out of my way to come  here again.
We enjoyed this place. The only issue we had was the Yuengling draft did not taste right. Otherwise, it was a nice place. Service was great. I would recommend this place.

Great drinks and if you sit outside, it’s a nice place for people watching during the right time of day.  I had a few Carlsberg beers during happy hour and some delicious dinner while sitting outside, then I had a Solace beer and a friendly chat with another bar goer.  Later, I returned to listen to karaoke and possibly sing a song and have some more drinks; there was a decent crowd for a Wednesday, and I would visit again for the karaoke.

Great place for a casual evening out. Ambience is lively and chirpy. Food is quite good, cocktails are top notch. Service was a tad slow but it could be because the place was nearly full. Definitely worth a revisit!

Stopped here because it wasn’t overly busy. The restaurant did fill up quickly as it got later at night. The food was good. We had nachos and burgers (1 regular & 1 veggie). The server checked in frequently. I would stop here again.
Easily and without a doubt the BEST BURGER that I’ve had in my life. WOW. Also, their french fries, which they personally cut in their own kitchen, were OUTSTANDING. This place deserves 100 stars!

While staying in Rosslyn we stopped at Rhodeside twice for evening libations and Sustenance. We found the drinks welcoming and the food Sufficiently Delectable and the service Excellently provided by Anastasia. Don’t hesitate to stop here

I visited the place as a single on a Satturday afternoon - mistake. It was very busy and extermly noisy. I had burger and beer. The burger was made from bread silces and overall very greasy! The fries were mushy and not freshly made. Sorry, but not for me, as I paid altogether (1x burger & 2x beer) 40 USD.

I just hosted a surprise birthday party at Screwtop & the event exceeded my expectations! We had 3 wines, lots of appetizers & everyone enjoyed every sip & bite. The event planner, Wendy created happy birthday placards with my husband’s name & a description of each wine - unexpected, appreciated, & elegant. The staff was extraordinary & very patient. The 10 guests wanted to mingle & did not want to be seated & we held up the service. All the staff were engaging & quickly attended to any special requests.. Thank you Wendy & Screwtop  Wine Bar for a perfect celebration!

I had never been to a wine bar before. In fact, I felt a little out of place until the friendly staff made me feel welcome. They all seem to love their jobs and they love to teach you about wine. Wine flights are a great way to enjoy and compare several different wines to see what it is you like and don’t like. They have an extensive wine list and a full kitchen with some unusual flavorful offerings.

Sitting at the bar is the most entertaining unless you have a bigger group. For six or more you can reserve one of two tables off to the side of the store which is away from the noise of the bar. (Or outside seating when it’s warmer).

We enjoyed flights of Cabernet and Sauvignon Blanc. We had a delicious cheese plate, spicy empanadas, savory Tuscan chicken flatbread, olives, almonds and corn nuts. Our waitress told us about our wines and answered all of our questions. She even brought us free samples of their frozen white wine and strawberry icy drink to try.

This is a great place to hang out, drink wine, eat good food, and converse with friends. It’s also a wine and cheese store, so you can bring home what you like.

I'm relatively new to Arlington and Screwtop has quickly become my favorite local spot! I frequently stop by for dinner and wine flights and have consistently been impressed with the excellent wine, food and knowledgable staff. I'm also a member of the wine club and cannot recommend it enough for any fellow winos! Each month we receive two high-quality red wines and a cheese for pairing - this is great for anyone who, like me, struggles to pick out wine on their own but wants to be a bit adventurous! Additionally, this past weekend my boyfriend worked with the owner, Wendy, to plan a surprise birthday party and it was such a memorable evening! They hand-selected wines for the flight and customized the entire experience. Thank you to the entire Screwtop team for hosting an excellent event!
I went here for wine tasting and tried the Valentine's Day flight. The wine, food, and service was really good. I would highly recommend this place.

Wendy and the entire team at Screwtop could not be MORE accommodating and helpful! They went above and beyond to help my sister's bridal shower brunch a special occasion - including custom menus, a custom tasting flight, coordination on decor and just fabulous service the day of. On top of that it was SO reasonably priced and the food and drink was all delicious! Highly highly recommend.

We came here for a weekend lunch, and the restaurant was almost fully packed. The mussels were just okay - many of them had sand inside. The Brussels sprouts was fine, but it’s definitely on the much more oil side of all the crispy Brussels sprouts that I’ve ever had. Overall, it didn’t particularly stand out, and I might not come back again.

Our second time at Lyon Hall. And this time we brought friends! Everything was just as perfect as the first time. My steak was perfectly cooked to how I wanted it. The cheeses were deliciously smooth and great with the fresh hot baguettes. They had tasty  vegetarian options too. Always a pleasure to visit Lyon Hall when we travel to DC.

From my (delayed) celebratory birthday dinner since someone special had to work on my actual birthday/ national holiday in France 🇫🇷. Not pictured was the (amazing) escargot 🐌 appetizer or the German beer 🥨. Overall a very happy girl with a French 75 cocktail, escargot, mussels vin blanc with frites & ANXO Nevertheless cidre. My husband and son ordered the pork schnitzel with a side of fried brussel sprouts and the clams and chorizo with a few rounds of beer. There was room for dessert which was a (savory decadence) of the chocolate pot de crème and cappuccino. C’était délicieux!

The restaurant offers French and German cuisines. A lot of meat options. The restaurant has two levels and outdoor seating. Street parking is available. They offer brunch, lunch, happy hour, and dinner.  We went for dinner. It was busy but we had a reservation. It’s a lively atmosphere with dim lighting. We tried the pretzel with smoked cheddar fondue, honey butter, and spicy mustard. I would prefer a softer pretzel but each spread complimented the pretzel well. The pan roasted salmon was good. We liked that they made the salmon skin crispy. The pork schnitzel was hearty. The cabbage was al dente and pickled just right.

We arrived without a reservation on a Saturday night and they were able to seat us which was nice. Unfortunately we chose a spot next to probably the loudest, most obnoxious group of guests in the place. Additionally, the restaurant dimmed the lights a bit much in the middle of the meal so it was hard to see after. Aside from that, the food was good. We got a half dozen oysters, the grilled octopus, the scallop entree and the beef Wellington. The total ~$145.

I can say the vibe is very easy going and laid back. There is no rush here meaning no one will make you feel like you need to hurry and eat because someone wants your table. The waiters will not pester you about what’s next and you can go at your own pace. With all that being said it takes time to get a drink or appetizers or entrees. But in my opinion on a lazy Saturday afternoon it fit. No complaints the food was respectfully priced and the taste was delicious. Nothing that was to die for or that stood out for me but no one in our party of 30 had a bad thing to say.
We celebrated my Aunts birthday and they accommodated our large party without issue. This place is popular and crowds quickly so thank goodness we had reservations. A very good time and family friendly. We even enjoyed the music. Overall good place with good eats. (No I didn’t get pics of everyone’s plates lol)

This place seems to have been here forever. Very nice and the food was really good. I had an issue though, because I forgot to ask about spices on the fries. They were so very accommodating – they made me whole new fries without any spices. In fact they were very accommodating about several food allergies. Really nice wait staff. But pay attention, because it is not exactly disability friendly. The restrooms are either upstairs or downstairs.

I visited here with my family while visiting the DC area. If you're looking for seafood and healthy portions, look no further.  The restaurant was small and quaint. It had character and smelled like a fish restaurant.  I had the fish and chips. One person could finish this, but would be very full! Split it with your partner and you'll both be satisfied. The clam chowder was delicious as well.  Other members of my family had the fried shrimp and clams. All were delicious. For more of my reviews on restaurants and other places of interest, follow me on Google reviews.

If you're craving blue crab or seafood, you've come to the right place. I didn't know this place existed until I looked for seafood near my home, so I didn't have to travel to Maryland for crab. We came here for our blue crab but ordered other dishes too while waiting for our main course to arrive after 35 minutes. The crab was perfectly cooked and had a delicious marinade, not salty like another crab restaurant we ate at before. Even though there were only 4 of us, we couldn't even finish a dozen of blue crabs. The service is excellent and very attentive whenever we need anything. They're ready for us in a second even though the place is crowded, but the staff run in and out of service like a breathe.

I highly recommend this blue crab restaurant for anyone craving crab and seafood but doesn't forget to make reservations in advance; otherwise, you will either be a long wait or will turn down with no table left for the evening.

Great wings and service.  My friend want crab cakes and when she called Tony indicated there was no wait. When we got there he was correct. You can make reservations. I got Buffalo Wings and she got crab cakes, mussels, mash potatoes and broccoli.  Everything looked, tasted and smelled delicious. They may be known for the whole crabs they serve, but other food is there as well. There's also a bar and to go area on the other side.

name: Green Pig Bistro
vicinity: 1025 North Fillmore Street Suite D, Arlington

reviews.text:
We celebrated a birthday here.  It was great to try somewhere new and this place was Fantastic!  The waiters were great!  We arrived for brunch at 1:40 and was served exceptionally quick.  Service was exceptional and food was spectacular!!  Not to mention that the drinks were exceptionally fresh and tasty!  My favorite was the everything waffle and the bacon was nothing less than PERFECT!!
Can't wait to return!!

I don’t know where to start! It was busy, so we were seated at the bar. The bartender gave us a round on him. The host moved us from the bar to seating at the appetizer and dessert chef’s station. They gave us free samples of everything they prepared! Our waiter was top notch, and everything was absolutely delicious. This was an amazing dining experience, and we will definitely visit again!

Overall really solid meal, but doesn’t make it into the realm of 5 stars for me.

Had the Huevos Rancheros and it was pretty much just a plate of braised pork. There’s nothing wrong with that but also meant that I had a lot of bites that all tasted the same and ended up with fair bit of leftovers.

First biscuit we had was delicious (warm/flaky/buttery) but second one was dry and crumbly. Cookie was tasty but also didn’t taste as fresh as I would’ve wanted. Almost like a packaged cookie.

We love the Pig. This place is casual enough for a quick drink, but elegant enough for a wedding anniversary. Every menu item I have ordered is always top notch, rich Southern flavor. The bar offers quality local drafts and custom cocktails. The service is consistent: great balance of 'we are here for every detail' + 'we can leave you alone to talk'. The only negative is the parking situation, but in Clarendon that's tricky for every restaurant. Easily one of our favorites in Arlington. A+

We stopped in for my girlfriend's birthday. We had the deviled eggs, two entees, and the bread pudding. Our server was great and the chef, Tracy, hit every entree out of the park. The bread pudding was the best I've ever had.

This place was so good and different. Eating sushi to the sounds of rock and roll 🎸 is so fun! The decor was really interesting. The food was the star of the show. It was so good! They had really interesting vegan and vegetarian item which I loved. I’ll find a reason to go back to that area and get more!

This place is an exciting way of mixing sushi and rock. Probably, one of the best sushi places I've ever had in the DMV area. On this first occasion, I tried the volcano, which was slightly spicy and quite tasty. However, I prefer the "you shook me all night long"...smooth and innovative. In both cases, the rice is at its exact point and optimal texture.

Local sushi spot for myself. Only been here three times but it’s a good spot. It’s pricey but you get what you pay for quality sushi. Nice outdoor patio to eat and enjoy the spring weather. Fresh, tasty and wide selection of sushi. My only issue was all the bugs on the patio. That was annoying for my boyfriend and I. Where bug spray if you eat outside in the spring or summer.

All around excellent Sushi restaurant. Deep fried California roll is a must try so rich in flavor! We got quite a few different rolls they were all excellent. The ahi tuna tower was not what I was expecting but it turned out to be surprisingly good! Only downside was when I got sashimi the cuts were WAY too thick. Just a small knit picky thing but still will come back here for sure!

Easy to find the place. Free Garage Parking available in the same building but limited spaces available. Street parking available but it’s tricky to find an open spot.
It is good to have reservations, if not they will accommodate for walk-ins during non-peak hours. Weekdays and Sunday evenings are pretty relaxed.
Ambiance is nice, Decor is excellent, seats are well cushioned, tables heights are decent and atmosphere is quiet.
Staff and service can be improved. You have to hunt for their attention. Food quality is good. I wasn’t impressed with Miso soup.
Maki was more than decent. I liked Tornado roll and stairway to heaven. Proud Mary crab roll wasn’t for my taste buds. Same with light my fire roll and you shook me all night. However crazy the names sound, if rolls don’t taste good, it’s not worth it. Size of sushi is on the smaller side. Overall, food was hit and miss for me. For the price, I was expecting a bit more.
Ginger and wasabi quantity was really nice. I noticed good waste reduction methods in restaurant. So kudos on that front.
Good place for family, friends and date nights. Outdoor seating available.
Read so many good reviews so I’ll return one more time to try more of the menu and update the review.

The came here for Sunday lunch without a reservation, but we got seated immediately without any waiting. Both the fried rice and fried rice noodle were good although the fried rice noodle was not exactly the Taiwanese style I was hoping for. The 1/2 roasted duck was crispy. Basil eggplant was standard. Overall, we enjoyed our lunch here and will come back whenever coming to this area. Street parking in nearby areas was not bad around noon on Sunday.

Service was good and ambiance was great. It’s not often you go to a Chinese restaurant that’s as chic and clean as this place.

However, I was a little underwhelmed by the dishes we got. The soup dumplings were average to me, the Peking duck was not as good as Peking Gourmet, and the beef chow fun was too soggy (beef was really soft and delicious though).

If I was in the area looking for a sit down Chinese place, then I would go here. Else, I would make the trek to a different place.

First time visiting this place even though been living in the area for years. Food - good Chinese food. It’s more family style sharing in my boyfriend and I’s opinion. Big portions in my opinion. It was tasty but a bit pricey though. Decor/vibe - surprisingly very nice inside and modern vibe. Service- excellent! Loved how anyone would wait on you. They served lemon water - big points for me being a water fan, lol. I’ll need to go again to try other dishes to be sure on the rating but yeah I would recommend you experience this restaurant.

Best Chinese food Ive ever had in the US. Restaurant was very clean with a nice atmosphere. Walnut shrimps, chicken casserole, double pork and sweet sour pork were all to die for (especially the walnut shrimp). Food was so good I had to come back again the next day :-)

Upon entering the restaurant, it gave me a very welcoming warm feeling, the staff was friendly.  The food was very delicious, it was cooked to perfection,  and the presentation was on point. The beer was very yummy.  Definitely recommend!

We came here for a birthday, for the brunch mania and honestly! Everyone was super impressed and satisfied with their food options. The food looked smelled and tasted so good I forgot to take pictures before we dug in. Amazing brunch perfect price. Event the .25 mimosas were made perfectly ! The ginger mimosa was made with their homemade ginger beer delicious. The spicy Margarita was good. The sangria we weren't too much of a fan of but besides that amazing meal. The gyro hash, Greek salad , falafel, hush puppies were all amazing from the first group. Chicken and waffles were great. The French toast is to literally die for baby baby baby . The spicy lamb Benedict but would be better with braised lamb. Brussels , banana fritters and Mykonian potatoes were soooo amazing !

INCREDIBLE brunch. Huge portions, friendly service, great taste. Drink deal and overall brunch deal can’t be beat. One of the few places in Arlington where I had a filling brunch as a vegan that tasted good and where I had multiple options- cannot recommend enough to those with similar dietary restrictions. Huge appreciation to Julia, our server, who was friendly, helpful, worked really well with my restrictions, and overall was fantastic. Big kudos to her!! Probably got a dinner out of the leftovers too- Certainly will be coming again, thanks so much!!

This restaurant is in the heart of Arlington do yourself a favor and visit this lovely restaurant. The service is unmatched. The staff truly cares about your experience. The food is absolutely amazing – I love to go for brunch  , Highly recommend!
French Toast is delicious,
Servers are also great and always efficient, happy and polite. Can’t wait to return and wouldn’t hesitate to recommend to anyone looking for somewhere to eat in CAVA..
ASK FOR TONY he's fantastic server.,

Our waiter was so nice. All of the food was delicious (we had tzatziki 10/10, mini gyros 8/10, risotto fritters 7/10, and chicken schnitzel 10/10) Lighting was dark but peaceful. No crazy loud music so it was nice to be able to hear the person I was with. The only thing that hampered the mood was the insanely rude hostess as soon as we walked in. Other than that, highly recommend!!

Brunch Mania is an incredible deal. We were expecting smaller plates, but instead we ended up full and happy with a box to take home! I got the hash gyro, spicy lamb Benedict, and banana fritters. I would have had some serious food FOMO if I didn’t do the brunch special. Love an option that lets me try multiple dishes!

First time going to Fire Works. They nailed the food and the drinks we got were delicious. Love a great neighborhood restaurant.

Service was a little choppy. Didn't see the our wait staff much. Understand when a customer rolls in with little kids that the table tends to be a little more high maintenance but that is part of doing business. The kids were well behaved and you should always bring extra napkins and check in drinks regularly.

Would highly recommend the pizza, truffle fries, and Mac and Cheese (comes with tomatoes in it, FYI.)

Great pizza! I recommend beating the dinner crowd if it's cold out because the indoor seats seem to fill up quick. By the time I left around 5 or 6 it was pretty packed! I tried a pizza with honey on it and loved it. 😋 the strawberry smash cocktail was pretty good too, just pretty small and full of ice haha.

The only half-way decent pizza I’ve been able to find in Arlington. The crust and sauce are good, the toppings are alright. I got the sweet heat, it was good but not much spice to it. The wine selection is ok. This would be a fun place for after work drinks or to bring a group of friends.

What a great experience! Juan the bartender was fantastic! He is personable, efficient, attentive and funny. He made our time here fun. The food was also delicious. We were so full! I appreciate the great hospitality and atmosphere. Props to Juan!

(Sep 2022) Update: they use cooked spinach (still tastes gross). They made their knots bigger so they stay softer. But I only order selectively. Got chicken parm which tasted good but it was slightly burnt. I go back more for the pizza rolls, knots, and parm when i get sporadic cravings, it’s close, and not as many options with similar menu without paying way more. I definitely miss NYC. Increased to 3 stars from 2. I at least appreciate their response and offer despite not having taken the offer. One good thing is the atmosphere with outdoor seating is always nice.

(Jan 2022) I’ve been going to this restaurant every so often for three years. It’s good. BUT, I’ve been more and more wary of going because I’ve had some more off experiences. 50% chance my garlic knots are reheated and hard as a rock. Sauce can be pretty acidic so if you get heartburn, prepare. And recently, after taking few-months-long hiatus, I got a pizza that was missing a topping and they used some kind of frozen/canned spinach which tasted like fish!!! $16 personal pizza and I’m at my end of “bad days”. For not going very often the scale has tipped towards “not going back” with their cost-saving options. I’d be happy to pay more for guaranteed quality. Not hit-miss gambles of canned garbage.

I love this place. Been here for lunch maybe 15 times in the last 5 years. It’s comfortable, not noisy, the food is reliably good and fresh. The lunch special is a terrific deal. And it’s family run so you get very personal service. Just call ahead if you’re bringing a big group so that they can plan to accommodate you well.

I came in alone while visiting from Seattle and got the opportunity to talk with the owner Helen while I ate. She is one of the sweetest women I've ever met. Her and her husband (the sushi chef) have owned the restaurant for 20 years, and they know what they are doing. My samurai roll was amazing, tempura was crunchy and just right, even the miso soup was tasty!

Covid has taken a toll on this little business, please don't miss eating here if you are in Arlington. The prices are great and the food is even better. It would be a tragedy if somewhere this good with owners so kind doesn't thrive!
Great, underrated restaurant. Family owned and a more personal experience than some of the other sushi restaurants in the area.

Hidden gem in Rossyln. Small, family-owned restaurant and a very nice couple. They have fast service and the best priced sushi in the area and high quality too! Will absolutely be making this a regular go-to spot.

I just can't understand any hate on this place. The ingredients are always fresh as can be, the service is prompt and professional, it's reasonably priced for the area, and everything's clean. Try the Chesapeake roll - I know it sounds a little weird but the thought to sprinkle a little old bay on sushi was delicious and inventive IMO.

Small portion off food 🍱 compared with The others , missing paper Towel . Missing chilly , missing top drink cups , and toilet you have to ask the code to use it , this is not New York!  is Arlington va ! Go across the street great food at cava plus same price and more health for your self

Just ordered dinner for delivery from here, the salad was horrible the onion wasn't even chopped and they gave me almost no dressing at all so I had to drive over there and ask for more because I didn't want to eat a completely dry salad.  In addition they gave me almost no chips, they barely covered the bottom of a small brown paper bag.  I don't have a high bar for Chipotle, but this is just pathetic it feels like I didn't get a full meal and what they did include they put no effort into.  I'm very disappointed.

The server gave me a small portion of steak, so I had to request Double meat to get a normal portion so I cost almost $18 for a regular bowl with double meat and guacamole (the server did give me a larger than regular portion of it, hence the 3 stars instead of 2) and a medium drink, no chips. Hopefully this store can correct this inconsistency, as Chipotle is my Go-To restaurant when I'm traveling...and I'm always travelling with my career.

Very disappointed with this place lately! The server gives you the bowl half full, you have to ask for more to get what you are paying for! And the carnitas...it is disgusting lately, it is the worst pork "meat" I have ever seen! It is some sort of fatty, slimy white-ish "thing" they sell as pork meat. Stay away until they decide to change their current ways!

Made an order at 10:30 for pick up at 11:30 bc I have a tight lunch. Get there at 11:33 and no ones there. Wait until 11:40 and someone comes up and demands my confirmation number. Didn’t bring my phone and she wouldn’t give until i went back and got it. Finally got it. Skimpiest portions if ever got. Barely half full.

I live in the area and this was first time I checked out this Mexican restaurant. Concise review - great service, nice vibe inside, and good, but not great food. The staff were very accommodating and friendly during lunch service. My date and I felt a good customer service experience. Vibe - I’m going to call it rustic artistic! Their are colorful paintings inside the restaurant and lived-in seating. It’s a chill vibe. Lighting could be a bit more even spread out, but it’s not like you can not see inside. Bathroom- it was clean, but yeah broken sink. You can still wash your hands, but it limits the experience not having hot water. Food - we order tacos. They were decent overall. I did like how you can mix up your three selections and tasty sides - rice and beans. Not the best tacos I’ve ever had, but yeah a bit simple in favor profile (taste, texture and garnish). Great free mild spicy salsa and chips though!

This place is simply great. The staff is really friendly. They always keep the chip bowl full. The margaritas are strong and the best value when you get a pitcher. The food is really good too. Everything I've gotten has been excellent from enchiladas to their mega burrito to tacos. I find myself going back here a lot because of the excellent service and good food.

Excellent customer service!
We had a great meal with a vegetarian option which to my surprise was even cheaper than the meat option. Hot sauce was provided, water was brought to my dog, and we had a couple of beers as well.
Outstanding service by Lucy! The food and drinks were great! Real Mexican food.

Sunday lunch time place was empty and I felt bit skeptical. However, it exceeded my expectations. Their salsa is a chipotle style the way l like. Margherita was done very well, good amount of salt on the rim. My tortila style 🥗 with shrimp 🍤 delicioso. Large shrimp juicy and fresh, quacamole freshly made, well seasoned, not too salty.
My friends burrito was gigantic. Very good food and value. Recommend 👍
